poem:
### Frantic Notes

In the sterile nighttime of the ward,
scrambled faces lit by screen's cold glow,
a father's quiet horror is obscured
by white coats typing frantic notes.
Outside moonlight glosses the asphalt,
while silent infants dream
of a world without air,
a world never prone 
to the frosty touch 
of steel and sorrow.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Father of babies killed by Lucy Letby tells inquiry of frantic scenes at hospital The father of two triplet babies murdered by Lucy Letby has described frantic scenes as the children collapsed, with medical staff appearing to search online for tutorials to guide them through “everyday” medical procedures. Letby injected air into the bloodstream of Child O and also into his stomach through a nasogastric tube, as well as administering air into the stomach of". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
